rooms.Name: Entrance to Blue Parrot
rooms.Description:
This small cubicle used as an entrance and as the bouncer's meeting place
is very dimly lit.  By the light of the dim lightbulb over your head
you notice a payphone to your left with an Out of Order sign on it.

Exits.Description: Outside the Blue Parrot
The waiting area of the Blue Parrot.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The payphone looks like one of those out of a 1920's movie.  The out
of order sign on it looks like it has been there for awhile.  You
decide that it would be better to leave it alone.

The payphone looks like one of those out of a 1920's movie.  The out
of order sign on it looks like it has been there for awhile.  You 
decide that it would be better to leave it alone.

rooms.Name: Dining area
rooms.Description:
There are plenty of tables in this room that you could sit down and
eat at.  You notice that there are some patrons sitting down, trying
to eat their meals, but as you walk in, most of them get up to
leave as they give you strange looks.
There seems to be someone still sitting in the back booth though, not
worried at all about you.

Exits.Description:
There is a stage area off to the north where you could watch the stage 
performance. Though you don't here any music from there yet.
The waiting area of the Blue Parrot.

The handsome man and beautiful woman are at this booth.  Of course, the
dog is also there.

rooms.Name: Back booth
rooms.Description:
The people sitting at the table ignore you as they are talking
very seriously about smuggling and gambling.  You hear Capone
mentioned once or twice in the time you're standing there.

Exits.Description: The main dining area is to the north.

rooms.Name: Performance room
rooms.Description:
This room has tables and chairs set up to face the stage for a performance.
It seems that the singer is a little bit late though, as the men seem to
be getting a little rowdy.  From all around you hear male voices chanting,
"Toni, Toni."  After awhile it gets unnerving.

Exits.Description: The actual stage that the singers perform on is to the east.
The main dining area is to the south.

rooms.Name: Stage
rooms.Description:
Standing on the stage, you hear the boos and hisses from the audience.
You hear from one of the tables "Hey, get off the stage.  I paid good
money to see Toni sing tonight."  Looking at the tables from here, you
almost get blinded by the stagelights.

Exits.Description: You could go behind the stage if you so choose to.
The performance room is west of you.

ExtraDescs.Description:
As you look at the lights you feel as if you are looking directly at 
the sun.  You begin to see spots in front of your eyes as you look
away, not able to stand it anymore.

The tables are set and people (mostly men) are sitting at them 
waiting for the show.  They look as though they will begin throwing
things at you if you don't remove yourself from the stage.

rooms.Name: Behind the stage
rooms.Description:
This is a small area behind the stage, almost like a small hallway
leading down to a door at the end.  The door reads "Dressing room."
There is a star taped to the door that says "Toni" on it.

Exits.Description: There is a door to a dressing room to the north
The stage is to the west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The star is old and worn.  The name Toni stands out in big black 
letters. The yellow color looks a little faded and you can catch
a little bit of metallic flakes in the color as if it was supposed
to be gold at one time.

rooms.Name: Dressing room
rooms.Description:
This rather large room has a vanity table at one end of the room, and
a couch on the wall to your left.  There are clothes strewn all over
the floor, tossed onto the couch, and hanging on wall lamps.

Exits.Description: You gaze at a large walk-in closet deciding if you should go in.
The area behind the stage is to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Attached into the walls, these lights come out a bit from them.  It
casts shadows in the room, but seems to light the room up fairly well.
The area by the vanity table though is well lit by these lights.

The couch looks comfortable.  You could almost just lay down and rest 
yourself, but all of the clothes strewn over it stop you.  You'd have
to figure out what to do with the clothes if you wanted to lay down.

The vanity table has a lot of makeup bottles and containers laid all
over the top of it.  You notice that some of the bottles have fallen
over, but luckily the lid was on so nothing is leaking.  There is 
nothing here that you would want.

rooms.Name: Closet
rooms.Description:
This closet seems to go on for a long time.  You are almost amazed by
the number of clothes still left in the closet because of the number
you saw strewn in the Dressing room.  You walk down the aisle gazing
at the clothes.  You realize that anything in here would not be good
to use as armor as it is only for show.

Exits.Description: The dressing room is to the west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You look at the clothes.  The are all for performance use and would not
make good armor.  Most of them are cut high onto the hip to show of
the legs of the person wearing the clothes.  You don't notice any clothes
or suits for men in here.

rooms.Name: Stairway
rooms.Description:
This stairway is very dimly lit by wall lamps on the side of the stairs.
You notice that there seems to be quite a bit of light coming from the
bottom of the stairs and you hear a lot of people talking down there.
Over all of this you notice the sound of gold exchanging hands.

Exits.Description:
When the door opens to let someone through, you catch a glimpse of the
main dining area on the other side.
There seems to be some noise coming from below you.

rooms.Name: Paradice
rooms.Description:
This seems to be the lobby of the casino.  There are comfortable chairs
against a few of the walls, but most of them are already taken and to be really
comfortable, you would have to sit at one of the tables.  The roulette wheel
is to your left, the blackjack table is in front of you, and the craps table
is to your right.  You also notice a row of slot machines behind you as you
gaze around the room trying to soak everything in.  Finally, you notice a 
small set of stairs descending into a very dimly-lit bar.

Exits.Description: A dark, smoky bar is down a small set of stairs.

rooms.Name: Blackjack tables
rooms.Description:
You sit down at a green, cloth covered table.  There are chips stacked
up on the other side of the table from you and the man behind the
table is constantly shuffling cards.

Exits.Description: The "lobby" of Paridice is south of you.

rooms.Name: Roulette wheel
rooms.Description:
A large wheel is the center of attention here.  The woman behind the table
spins it and drops a marble onto it and waits until it settles into one of the
spots.  She then calls out the winning number and color, making most of the
patrons groan and leave.

Exits.Description: The "lobby" of Paradice is east of you.

rooms.Name: Row of Slot Machines
rooms.Description:
The one-armed bandits look as though they are very hungry and want your
gold. There is a chance that you might win, but you never know, you 
could also lose.

Exits.Description: The "lobby" of Paradice looks a little crowded.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
The road is paved with tar, one of the few you've noticed around here.  
Buildings line both sides of the street, but the one that really stands out
is a restaurant called the Blue Parrot.  You've heard that the food there is
good, the wine is better, and the women are the best around.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave continues.
An old abandoned building is rotting here.
The intersection of Pierwalk Ave and Monroe.
The entrance to the Blue Parrot

rooms.Name: Abandoned Warehouse
rooms.Description:
This is a very large, empty room.  You see cobwebs in the corner and a
rat's nest in a corner on the floor, because it's been so long since
anyone has been in this building.  You can see gaps in the ceiling,
floorboards for the upper floor.  The only light coming into this
place is through the cracks in the walls.  Something about this place
gives you an eerie feeling.

Exits.Description: You can see Pierwalk Ave and the Blue parrot looking out the cracks.
Stairs head up to the second floor.

rooms.Name: Upstairs Warehouse
rooms.Description:
This room is as large and as empty as the main room had been.  There 
seems to be more spiderwebs up here then downstairs.  You notice a 
door in the far west wall.  Checking out the sturdiness of the floorboards
they creak as you put even a little pressure on them.  It also looks
as if the termites have had a field day with this place.

Exits.Description:
You don't know if the floorboards are going to be able to take all
of your weight.  And if you fall, you'll probably die.
The main room of the warehouse still looks as empty as when you came in.

rooms.Name: Back room
rooms.Description:
You try to walk to the door in the west wall, but as you place your
weight on the floorboards they give out under you.  You
P
L
U
M
M
E
T
To the main floor and break your NECK.

YOU HAVE     D I E D

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave, and beyond that, The Blue Parrot.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
The road is paved with tar, one of the few you've noticed around here.
Most of the roads seem to be made out of brick.  Buildings line either
side of the street, but the one that seems to stand out is Johnny's
Jewels. To the east is one of the Great Lakes.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk ave just before interesecting with Washington Street.
The Blue Parrot and an abandoned warehouse are here.
The enterance to Johnny's Jewels is a nice glass door.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You gaze out over the lake.  It seems to go on forever without stopping.
If you didn't know any better you would believe it to be the ocean, but
it doesn't have the salt smell that the ocean does.  It smells more of
fresh, clean, water.

rooms.Name: Johnny's Jewels
rooms.Description:
The carpeting is a very soft, velvet looking red.  The glass display
cases are placed on solid oak pedestals.  Within the display cases you
notice earings, rings, necklaces and bracelets spread evenly on black
velvet.

Exits.Description: The entryway is here.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
This road is paved with black tar, one of the few around here.  Buildings
line the west side of the road.  To the east is one of the Great Lakes.
The building that gets your attention here is Johnson's Corner Store
located on the corner of Pierwalk Ave and Washington Street.

Exits.Description: The intersection of Pierwalk ave and Washington street.
Pierwalk Ave continues
Johnson's Corner store is a good place to by your supplies.

rooms.Name: Johnson's Corner Store
rooms.Description:
The hard tile floor echos every step you make in the store.  The cash
register is immediatly before you and behind it stands Mr. Johnson.
Behind Mr. Johnson is the candy shelves.  There are chips to your
left and automotive supplies to your right.

Exits.Description: The entrance to the store lies to the east.

rooms.Name: Intersection
rooms.Description:
This street is one of the first streets in the city to be paved with black tar.
Buildings line the street, and one of the Great Lakes can be seen to the east.
Pierwalk Ave runs north and south from here, and Washington Street runs to the
west.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave continues

There is an old pier here.  You see a lighthouse towards the end
of the pier.  A small figure is sitting on the pier about halfway
between you and the lighthouse.
Pierwalk ave continues.
Washington street begins.

rooms.Name: Washington Street
rooms.Description:
This is a brick road that ends at Pierwalk Ave to the east.  It continues
westward and the buildings lining it may be of some interest.

Exits.Description: The Riveria Theatre.  Good place to relax. Not much else.
The intersection of Washington Street and Pierwalk Ave.

Bernie's News Corner is located on the corner of Pierwalk ave and 
Washington Street.
Washington Street continues

rooms.Name: Pier
rooms.Description:
This old pier creaks under your weight as you walk to the end.  There
is a can of worms sitting here and fish in a bucket.  The reflection
of buildings off from the lake, the birds flying overhead and the
fish jumping in the lake is breathtaking.

Exits.Description: Do you really want to step off the pier?
The lighthouse looms above you.
Do you really want to step off the pier?
The pier continues towards the shore.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
This road is paved with black tar, one of the few you've seen in this
world. Buildings line the west side of the road and to the east is
a Great Lake and a small, open-air fishmarket.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave continues
The open-air fishmarket sells fish and bait.
The intersection of Pierwalk Ave and Washington street.
The enterance to Lakefrount City's First National Bank.

rooms.Name: Fishmarket
rooms.Description:
This is an open-air fishmarket.  To your right is a basket full of small fish
caught right out of the Great Lake located behind the fishmarket (at least 
that's what the sign says).  You believe that some of them are still fresh
(by the few that are still squirming) but most of them have probably been
frozen at one time or another.  To your left is an assortment of Fisherman's
Magazines, one of the few dedicated to fishing.  (Of course the newest copy
isn't there, but it is located on the counter, where the owner of this market
is reading it.)  Hanging overhead is one BIG fish, stuffed and displayed to
prove that there are BIG fish in the Great Lakes.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave

rooms.Name: Lakefront City First National Bank
rooms.Description:
This is your typical bank.  Along one wall is a row of booths where bank tellers
wait to help people with their financial transactions.  Near the door to your
right rest several chairs where you may wait your turn.  On the far wall you
see a huge steel door, obviously protecting a fortune in valuables.  A lone
bank guard stands here, staring at you suspiciously.  The bank manager begins
to lock away several stacks of newly counted money as you enter.  Your footsteps
echo loudly on the hard tile floor as you walk about, and the scent of this
place reeks of dirty money.

Exits.Description: The entryway is here.

rooms.Name: Bar
rooms.Description:
The bar is hazy because of all the smokers in here.  You can barely
make out shapes of people with the combination of dim lights and
smoke. There are stools lined up at the bar, but most of them are
taken.

Exits.Description: The brightly lit lobby of the casino is up a small set of stairs.

rooms.Name: Riviera Theatre
rooms.Description:
There are posters on the wall advertising for "The Gold Rush" with Chaplin,
"The Big Parade" with Vidor, "The Ghost of Moulin Rouge" with Clair and
"Go West" with Keaton.  This might be a good place to hang out and
relax, but you don't think you'll find much else in there.

Exits.Description: The lobby of the Riveria theatre is located north of you.
Washington Street is as safe as any can be these days.

rooms.Name: Theatre
rooms.Description:
The theatre is very dark.  The only light is coming from the screen.  
There seems to be a lot of empty seats if you want to sit down and
watch "The Gold Rush" with Chaplin.

Exits.Description: The lobby of the Riveria Theatre.

rooms.Name: Intersection
rooms.Description:
This is the intersection of Pierwalk Ave and Monroe Ave.  Pierwalk is
a tar paved road heading north and south.  Monroe is a brick layed road
headed east and west.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave.
Pierwalk Ave continues.
The street called Monroe

rooms.Name: Monroe Street
rooms.Description:
Monroe is a brick lined street that heads east and west.  The buildings 
lining the sides of the street here are rather boring.

Exits.Description: Intersection of Pierwalk and Monroe.
Monroe continues.

rooms.Name: Monroe Street
rooms.Description:
The street is brick layed and very dimly lit in this area.  There is a pawn
shop south from here and a doctor's office to the north.  Monroe continues
east and west from here.

Exits.Description: Dr. Jack's office
Monroe continues
Derrick's Pawn shop
Monroe continues.

rooms.Name: Monroe Street
rooms.Description:
This is a brick layed street that heads east and west.  Some of the buildings
that line the sides are very interesting, but most are boring.  There
is nothing of interest on this block.

Exits.Description: Monroe continues.
Interseciton onf Monroe street and Maple alley.

rooms.Name: Derrick's Pawn Shop
rooms.Description:
Before you lies a vast array of tables, shelves, cabinets, and display cases
cluttered with a myriad of invaluable trinkets.  Antique clocks, pawned jewelry,
leather backpacks, old bottles, dusty lanterns, and every other imaginable type
of miscellaneous junk that is even remotely valuable lies here, waiting to be
purchased.  The clerk here seems busy examining a finely-wrought golden watch.
Judging by all that you see available, you are positive that you can purchase
anything you need here, for the right price.  A doorway to the east leads into
another room of the shop, where other types of items are bought and sold.  The
doorway to the north will take you back out to Monroe Street.

Exits.Description: Monroe street
The large room continues east.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This high-quality golden watch seems a little out of place here.  Engraved on
the back are the words 'Property of the Terratech Corporation'.

rooms.Name: Doctor Jack's Office
rooms.Description:
This is a common doctor's office.  In the center of the room rests an
examination table.  Against the far wall is a cabinet filled with all manners
of pills, tonics, and elixirs.  On a stand behind the examination table rests
some steel surgical equipment.  Against the right wall lies a large steel sink.
Doctor Jack can usually be found here, sitting at his desk doing paperwork.

Exits.Description: Monroe street

rooms.Name: Intersection
rooms.Description:
Intersection of Monroe Street and Maple Alley.  Maple alley looks dark
and foreboding and goes north and south.  Monroe street is dimly lit, but
much brighter than Maple alley.
Monroe goes east and west.

Exits.Description: Maple alley looks dark and foreboding
Monroe is dimly lit, but continues.

rooms.Name: Maple alley
rooms.Description:
Maple alley is a very dark and eerie street.  It continues north and
south from here.  To the west you notice a small church.

Exits.Description: Maple Alley continues.
Intersection of Maple Alley and Monroe.
An old abandoned church is here.

rooms.Name: Mob distribution room for area 6
rooms.Description:
This is a room to let the mobs that wander around Chicago not be crowded
into one room.

rooms.Name: Monroe Street
rooms.Description:
This is the end of Monroe Street.  This dark and filthy dead end is inhabited
mainly by rats and bums.  To the north is an abandoned building, ready to be
demolished.  The hair on the back of your neck prickles as you get the feeling
you are being watched.

Exits.Description: An old, abandoned storefront with a broken window.
Intersection of Monroe street and Maple alley.

rooms.Name: Abandoned Store
rooms.Description:
Shattered glass lies on the floor, crunching beneath your feet as you walk
around examining the room.  There is a small staircase in the back of the room
that leads upstairs.  Display cases that once held expensive merchendise are
broken and the splinters of wood lie among the shards of glass.

Exits.Description: Monroe.
The stairs go up to the second floor.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
This is a tar paved road, one of the few you've seen in this area, that
runs north and south.  Buildings line either side of the road.  To the
east is Torina's Restaurant.  To the west is Mariano's Furriers.  The
rest of the buildings do not catch your attention.

Exits.Description: Intersection of Monroe and Pierwalk Ave.
Torina's Restuarant
Mariano's Furriers

rooms.Name: Mariano's Furriers
rooms.Description:
This store is filled with plush furs of every type.  Fur coats, vests, and hats
line the racks here.  The furs come in every type and color, from mink coats
to racoon-skin hats.  On the walls are mounted the heads of many of the animals
that "contributed" to the shop's collection.  As you look down, you notice a
bear-skin rug looking back up at you.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave.

rooms.Name: Torina's Restuarant
rooms.Description:
As you walk in the first thing you notice is the delicious aroma wafting
through the air.  Many candle-lit tables are here, with patrons waiting to be
served.  Waitresses are busy carrying large steel trays covered with plates of
food around to all the tables.  Soft violin music catches your ear as you
notice that you are next in line to receive a table.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave

rooms.Name: Washington Street
rooms.Description:
Traveling along the brick-lined road, you see the majestic Lexington
Hotel to the north.  Farther down the road to the west, you notice a
barber shop and to the east a newstand and the Riviera Theatre.
Washington street continues east and west.

Exits.Description: Leddington Hotel
Washington Street continues.
Another section of Washington Street.

rooms.Name: The Lexington Hotel
rooms.Description:
The brightness of this room is almost blinding.  The light shined
down from the chandiliers is reflected off the gold and silver
lined arches and pillars.  The fountain in the center of the 
room is virtually breathtaking as the water flows from the open
fish's mouth down 3 lilypad layers into the basin.  The people
roaming around the room are well dressed in tuxes and evening
dresses. Bellhops also roam around the lobby, always ready
to take stuff up to rooms for a tip.

Exits.Description: The grand stairway is to the north.
The revolving doors to the street lie to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Looking closer at the fountian you realize that the stone fish
is a replica of a coy.  You remember a saying you heard once, a
while back which went something like:  "Happiness is coy in a
pond." You smile as you think of this and watch the water flow
down to the basin.

rooms.Name: 2nd Floor
rooms.Description:
The plush red carpeting gives way easily under your feet.  The 
chandeliers over your head give off a low glow, enough to see 
your way to the rooms, but not much more than that.

Exits.Description: You see the door to room 209.
The 2nd floor hallway continues eastward.
It looks like an elevator.
The 2nd floor hallway continues westward.
Third floor of the Leddington Hotel.
The grand stairway is below you.
You see the door to room 210.
You see the door to room 208.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The chandeliers give off a soft glow.  You see nothing special
about them.

rooms.Name: 3rd Floor
rooms.Description:
This is the top floor of the hotel.  You can see right away that this is where
all the wealthy and powerful people stay.  The floor is covered by a plush red
rug that is routinely kept clean by the maids.  Several large suites make up
the only rooms on this floor.  The doors to each suite are ornately engraved
and decorated with gold-leaf designs.  The hallway is well lit by several
brass lamps attached to the walls.  A guard posted outside one of the rooms
eyes you suspiciously.

Exits.Description: There is a door here.
2nd floor Leddington Hotel.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
This road is one of the first you've ever seen that has been paved with black
tar.  Many important buildings line this street.  To the east a Great Lake can
be seen in the distance, while a condemned building lies, all boarded up, on
the western side of the street.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave continues
Pierwalk Ave continues

rooms.Name: Bernie's News Corner
rooms.Description:
This is a newspaper stand.  It looks like a big box made out of wood with
an opening for a shelf.  Papers and magazines are located in racks and
spread on the shelf.  The owner is leaning on the shelf reading one of
his newest magazines.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk ave is here.

rooms.Name: Washington Street
rooms.Description:
This is a well-worn brick road that has seen quite a bit of use.  To the south
is Jerry's Barber Shop.  If you went north, you could walk down Broad Street
towards Union Street.

Exits.Description: Broad street is lined with cars and heads towards Union Street.
Another section of Washington Street.

The Red, White, and Blue swirl light tells you that this is a 
barber's shop.  Jerry's Barber Shop to be precise.
The intersection of Washington Street and Maple alley.

rooms.Name: Jerry's Barber Shop
rooms.Description:
This is a typical barber shop.  On a coatrack by the door hand several jackets
and trenchcoats.  There are two barber's chairs here and several normal chairs
for customers waiting their turn.  A large mirror hangs on one wall, with a sink
directly below it.  On a stand between the barber's chairs can be found numerous
pairs of scissors, combs, and razors, as well as a bucket of shaving lather.
On another wall you see several pictures hanging.  one of the pictures is of a 
handsome, well-dressed, middle-aged man who really resembles one of the local
crime lords.  Several frightened customers scurry out the door at your arrival.

Exits.Description: You can see washington street outside the door.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This is a picture of the notorious crime-boss Al Tolino.  You wonder what
association he has with Jerry the barber...

rooms.Name: Waiting area
rooms.Description:
There are chairs lined up against the two walls for people to sit in
while waiting to be seated.  There is a large sign in front of you.

Exits.Description: The entryway to the Blue Parrot
The dining area of the Blue Parrot.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:

Please seat yourself.  We will be with you shortly.

Thank you.

rooms.Name: Broad Street
rooms.Description:
This is a very wide road that runs between Union Street and Washington
Street. Like most of the other streets around here, it's laid with
reddish-brown bricks which are cracked from all of the travel on them.
Cars line the sides of the road, in front of stores that do not catch
your intrest.

Exits.Description: Broad Street continues to the north towards Union Street.
Broad street runs into Washington street here.

rooms.Name: C T T Builders
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a room crowded with steel and other various metals.  You
can see many people hard at work here, trying to turn out the best product
possible.  The street is to the west.

Exits.Description: You see Broad street outside the door

rooms.Name: Broad Street
rooms.Description:
This is a well worn, reddish-brown, wide brick road.  It travels north
to Union Street and south to Washington Street.  Bugs flower shop is
to the west and CTT (Cat/Techie/Terabyte) builders is to the east.

Exits.Description: Broad Street continues north.
The building for Jennings Builders is located here.
Broad Street continues south towards Washington Street.

The big glass window reads "BUGS FLOWER SHOP".  You believe it might, just
might, be a flower shop.

rooms.Name: Off the pier...
rooms.Description:
You walk off the edge of the pier and SPLASH!!  As you climb out of the
Great Lake, you think to yourself that you *really* ought to look where
you're walking.  Unless you're LOOKING for cement shoes?

Exits.Description: The pier lies here.

rooms.Name: Upstairs Abandoned Store
rooms.Description:
This is the second floor of the abandoned store.  It appears to have been a
storage room for the store below.  Large wooden crates lie strewn about,
shattered open and their contents stolen.  A cold draft blowing in through a
broken window chills your soul.  The floor boards creak loudly as you step into
the room.

Exits.Description: An abandoned store is here.

rooms.Name: Lobby of Theatre
rooms.Description:
The red carpet is soft under your feet.  There are chairs and sofas 
placed against the wall.  To your right is a counter to buy various
theatre treats.

Exits.Description: The darkened theatre.
The entrance of the Riveria Theatre is here.

rooms.Name: Monroe Street
rooms.Description:
This is the end of Monroe Street.  To the east you see one of the Great Lakes.
The buildings on each side of the road are dark and gloomy.  Garbage lines the
sides of the street, in and out of trash cans.  You see a small rat scurry
through the debris.

Exits.Description: Jeapordy Road leads north from here.

rooms.Name: Grand Stairway
rooms.Description:
The plush red carpet gives softly beneath your feet as you climb
the stair.  The view of the lobby from here is majestic as you look
out over the glass chandeliers which softly light the lobby below.

Exits.Description: The main lobby is to the south.
The first floor of the hotel is up the stairs.

rooms.Name: 2nd Floor
rooms.Description:
This hallway leads to a dead end with several doors to rooms on either side.
The floor is covered by an expensive red carpet and brass lamps light the hall.
The doors to each room are securely locked.

Exits.Description: The stairway leading down is off the second floor to the west.

rooms.Name: 2nd Floor
rooms.Description:
The hallway ends in a window overlooking the street below.  Doors line both
sides of the hall, but as you check them you discover that only one of them
is unlocked.  You quietly walk on the soft red carpet and open the door, but
the light given off by the brass lamps here is not enough to see inside the
room.

Exits.Description: The stairway to the main floor is off the hallway to the east.
Room 201

rooms.Name: Entrance to Johnny's Jewels
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the entrance to Johnny's Jewels.  Glancing inside the
building, you can see all the jewelry that Johnny sells laid out in glass cases
on black velvet lining.  Going back outside will take you to Pierwalk Ave.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave is outside the door.
Johnny's Jewels is just one step inside.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Lakefront City First National Bank
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the entrance to Lakefront City First National
Bank. The glass doors rise far over your head.  Just inside is
a security guard ready to fight you if you cause any trouble.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave lies outside the doors.

The main bank with tellers and operators lies just one step
inside the building.

rooms.Name: Maple Alley
rooms.Description:
The alley here is dark and gloomy.  Garbage is strewn along the sides of it. 
An alley cat hisses as you approach and scurries away.

Exits.Description: Maple alley continues
Maple Alley continues.

rooms.Name: First American Church
rooms.Description:
This church is extremely old and run down.  It looks as though no reasonable
person has set foot in it for awhile.  But you have heard rumors that gangs,
wanted criminals, and cults sometimes use it for their meeting place.  You
think you saw a light coming from the altar as you came in.

Exits.Description: Maple alley is outside the big double doors.
You push the altar aside to reveal a hidden staircase down

ExtraDescs.Description: You see a bloodstained altar here

rooms.Name: Maple Alley
rooms.Description:
Maple Alley is dark and dreary.  Even during the day there isn't
much sunlight here due to the closeness of the buildings.  Clotheslines
connect apartments and the laundry hangs from them to dry in the
wind. You squeeze between the buildings to continue on your way.

Exits.Description: Maple Alley continues
Maple Alley continues.

rooms.Name: Maple Alley
rooms.Description:
Maple Alley is dark and dreary.  Even during the day there isn't
much sunlight here due to the closeness of the buildings.  Clotheslines
connect apartments and the laundry hangs from them to dry in the
wind. You squeeze between the buildings to continue on your way.

Exits.Description: Intersection of Maple alley and Washington Street.
Maple Alley continues

rooms.Name: Intersection
rooms.Description:
Washington Street runs east, while Maple alley runs north and
south. Washington Street is a brighter section of town then
Maple Alley is.  In fact, Maple alley looks very run down while
Washington street seems to be the best part of town.

Exits.Description: Maple Alley continues.
Washington street.
Maple Alley continues.

rooms.Name: Maple Alley
rooms.Description:
Maple Alley is dark and dreary.  Even during the day there isn't
much sunlight here due to the closeness of the buildings.  Clotheslines
connect apartments and the laundry hangs from them to dry in the
wind. You squeeze between the buildings to continue on your way.

Exits.Description: The intersection of Maple Aleey and Washington Street

rooms.Name: Pier
rooms.Description:
Standing at the edge of the pier, you see how far it extends out into
the water.  You are thoroughly impressed by the lighthouse at the
end of the pier.  You realize how nice that would look with a 
sunset in the background.

Exits.Description: The pier continues towards the lighthouse.

The intersection between Pierwalk Ave and Washington Street is to the
west.

rooms.Name: Lighthouse
rooms.Description:
Glancing at the big, red lighthouse from this distance, you can see
the individual bricks that make it.  You climb over rocks, listening
to the waves crash over them and smelling the fresh water, to get
closer to it.  When you get to it, you notice a door, slightly ajar,
open just enough so you can get into the lighthouse.  It looks as if
the lock was broken.

Exits.Description: The door is open enough for you to squeeze into the lighthouse.
The pier stretches back to the beach.

rooms.Name: First floor of Lighthouse
rooms.Description:
This is the lowest level of the lighthouse.  It is damp and dusty here.  The
wooden floor creaks loudly as you step upon it.  A winding stairway leads
upwards into the darkness...  You feel as though you are being watched.

Exits.Description: The door is open enough for you to leave the lighthouse.
These stairs lead up to the 2nd floor.

rooms.Name: Second floor of lighthouse
rooms.Description:
The spiraling staircase leads ever upwards from here.  The wooden boards that
make up the stairs are well worn, and in good condition.  A loose board creaks
as you step on it.  You get the eerie feeling that you are being watched again.

Exits.Description: These stairs go up to the third level.
These stairs lead down to the main floor of the lighthouse.

rooms.Name: Third Floor of Lighthouse
rooms.Description:
It is damp and musty here, but you feel a slight breeze blowing down the steps.
The steps are in worse condition here...maybe you should go back down.

Exits.Description: These stairs go up to the Forth floor.
These stairs go down to the second floor.

rooms.Name: Fourth Floor of Lighthouse
rooms.Description:
You can definitely feel a slight breeze blowing through here from above.  The
stairs are dusty and decayed, and creak loudly as you step on them.  You aren't
sure if the steps can hold your weight for long.  You notice a tiny spider
crawling on the wall.

Exits.Description: These stairs go up to the fifth floor.
These stairs go down to the Third Floor

ExtraDescs.Description: This is a just a tiny black spider.  What possible importance could it hold?

rooms.Name: Fifth Floor of Lighthouse
rooms.Description:
This is the top of the lighthouse.  In the center of the room is a brightly-
lit lamp revolving slowly in a circle.  The view of the bay area from here is
breathtaking.  You can see for many miles out over the lake.  Behind you lies
the city, dark and forboding, covered by a haze of pollution.  A gentle breeze
can be felt here, blowing in through an open window.

Exits.Description: These stairs go down to the Forth Floor.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This is a slowly spinning oil-burning light.  The light seems to be in good
condition and is working properly.  You don't know why you bothered to look at
this at all.

rooms.Name: Craps Table
rooms.Description:
You stand at the craps table.  It's green, velvet-lined throwing pit is begging
you to throw the dice and test your luck.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Ave
rooms.Description:
This newly paved street is lined with buildings.  On the eastern side of the
street is an ice cream parlor and a clothing store is to the west.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave continues north

Lakeside Ice Cream Shoppe looks inviting.  The desplays in the
window are marvelous making you crave for the homemade ice cream
that they serve.
Pierwalk Ave continues.

The clothing store looks inviting.  Probably nothing worthwhile there,
but you can never be sure unless you look.

rooms.Name: Lakeside Ice Cream Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This small ice cream parlor is filled with teenagers gossiping about the 
latest events at school.  A long counter near the right wall is lined with
spinning stools for your enjoyment.  A freezer in the back is filled with 
every flavor of ice cream you could ever want.  There must be at least 
fourteen different kinds!  There is a juke box near the back, playing the 
latest craze in music today.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave lies outside these doors.

rooms.Name: Room 208
rooms.Description:
This is a simple hotel room.  The bed against one wall is unmade, and there
is the lingering smell of cheap perfume around the room.  On each side of the
bed are small night stands, one of which has some tissue paper with red
lipstick stains on it.  The bathroom door along the far wall is ajar and all
the lights are off.

Exits.Description: The 2nd floor hallway is here.

rooms.Name: Room 209
rooms.Description:
This is a simple hotel room.  A large bed rests against one wall, with a 
nightstand on either side of it.  A clothes rack near the door has the hat and
coat of the current occupant of the room.  A small bathroom with a sink, toilet,
and mirror, can be seen through a doorway on the far wall.

Exits.Description: 2nd floor hallway.

rooms.Name: Room 210
rooms.Description:
This is your average hotel room.  A large bed rests against one wall, with
night stands located along either side.  An empty coat rack sits next to the
door.  A closed door on the far wall leads to a small bathroom.  This room
appears to be unoccupied.

Exits.Description: 2nd floor hallway.

rooms.Name: PierWalk Clothing Store
rooms.Description:
Racks and racks of clothing fill the room, just waiting to be purchased.  
Fine men's business suits, elegant dresses and gowns of every style and color,
any kind of hat you could every desire, and even men's ties line every shelf
and clothing rack in the store.  A dressing room with a mirror is located in
the back of the store.  The store smells of new clothing.

Exits.Description: You see PierWalk Ave outside the door.

rooms.Name: Room 201
rooms.Description:
This is your typical hotel room.  A large bed rests against one wall, with
bed stands on either side.  A coat rack with a coat and hat on it is by the 
door.  And a small bathroom can be seen through a door on the far wall.

Exits.Description: Second floor hallway.

rooms.Name: Inside the Bank Vault
rooms.Description:
This is the inside of the vault, where all the bank's money is kept.  Along
the right-hand wall are many safety deposit boxes filled with the important
possessions of many rich and powerful members of the city.  Along the other
wall are several smaller vaults where most of the bank's money is kept.  On a
table along the far wall is a pile of ancient gold coins, undoubtedly waiting
to be placed into one of the safety deposit boxes.  As you walk around the
room checking for unlocked safes, you hear an alarm ringing in the background.
You'd better get out of here soon, before the police arrive.

rooms.Name: Elevator
rooms.Description:
You are standing in an elevator.  There are a button on the wall.
Other than that, you see nothing important.

Exits.Description: There is a hallway here.

rooms.Name: A secret altar
rooms.Description:
You descend the staircase to find yourself in front of a secret altar hidden
below the church.  By the markings on the walls, you expect that some sort of
cult is using it.......and the lighted candles and chanting tells you they are
using it right now!!!!!!!!!!!

Exits.Description: You go back up the stairs

rooms.Name: Broad Street
rooms.Description:
This is well worn, reddish-brown, wide brick road.  It travels north
and south.  There is nothing of interest along the sides of the road.

Exits.Description: Broad street continues south.

rooms.Name: Intersection
rooms.Description:
This is the intersection of Broad and Union Streets.  Broad street runs to 
the south, while Union Street runs east.  Be careful bacause the dark 
alleys running off from Union Street can be deadly.

Exits.Description: Broad street runs south.

rooms.Name: Derricks Pawn Shop
rooms.Description:
In this room rests several tables, racks, and display cases lined with all
types of armor and clothing.  Antique suits of armor, battered shields, dusty
helmets, and used clothing can all be found here in abundance.  The clerk
seems distracted by a leather belt that won't adjust properly.  From here you
may go to the west, or south through another doorway.

Exits.Description: You notice a back room to the pawn shop.
The large room continues west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This leather belt has a platinum, jeweled clasp, and glows dimly.  It seems to
come apart every time the clerk fixes it, making his pants fall down around
his knees.  The clerk seems very embarrased...

rooms.Name: Back room of Derricks Pawn Shop
rooms.Description:
Weapons of all types line the tables and racks on the walls.  Ancient swords,
dusty axes, and even small handguns lie out on the shelves.  Derrick, the owner,
hints that more modern weaponry might be available, if the price is right.
Some larger guns of an unknown design lie, partially covered, in a glass case
in the corner.  From here you can go to the north or southwest into a darker
back room of the shop.

Exits.Description: The main room of Derricks Pawn Shop.
More of the back room of Derrick's Pawn Shop.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This gun is large, shiny, and seems to be made of an unknown metal.  There is
no place to load ammunition, and is makes a low humming sound.  This gun
would be a very powerful addition to your equipment, if Derrick would be willing
to sell it.

rooms.Name: Back room of Derricks Pawn Shop
rooms.Description:
This room has a dark, mystic aura about it.  A dark-robed figure stands over
the tables here, watching you intently.  Gnarled staves, glittering wands,
dusty tomes, and bubbling potions await you here.  The room is barely lighted
by several candles that smell heavily of incense.  The only exit is to the
northeast.

Exits.Description: The back room of Derricks Pawn Shop.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This magnificent staff rests in the corner of the shop.  Ancient runes of power
wrap around the mighty oaken staff from one end to the other.  Each end of the
staff is encased in the purest mithril, and the upper section is encrusted
with a king's ransom in jewels of all types, forming a spiraling rainbow
pattern towards the tip.  At the very top of the staff is a huge sapphire
inscribed with a strange runic sumbol.  As if by magic, you immediately
realize that the symbol marks the staff as being property of the High Archmage
of Stormhaven, the mighty Diabla Hellborne herself.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Johnson's Corner Store
rooms.Description:
This is the store entrance, where shopping carts are kept.  Several newspaper
vending machines are also here, sitting against one wall.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Avenue lies outside the door.
The main store.

rooms.Name: The Lexington Hotel
rooms.Description:
This is the enterance to the majestic Lexington Hotel.  Looking up,
you see the grand building rise befor you, it must be one of the tallest
buildings in the city.  Directly above the doorway is an arched black
roof to shelter guests from the rain.  The neon sign buzzes noisily
above you.  Standing in the doorway are several bellhops waiting
to greet you and take your bags.

Exits.Description: The inside of the Leddington hotel looks nice and dry.
Washington street lies outside the revolving doors.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
This newly paved road keeps going north.  To the west is a train
station, bustling with people.  To the east a Great Lake is barely
visible through the haze of pollution caused by the growing industries
and increased use of motorized vehicles.

Exits.Description: Pierwalk Ave continues south.

rooms.Name: Trolley Station
rooms.Description:
A rather dirty train/trolley station sits here, hushed with the 
expectancy of the next train arriving.

rooms.Name: Train Tracks
rooms.Description:
Train tracks.  Yep, that's what they are.  As you're stading here, you
REALLY hope that a train isn't due anytime soon.  The tracks go
southwest and northeast.

rooms.Name: Bugs's Flower shop
rooms.Description:
This room is filled with the pleasant aroma of flowers.  Surrounding you are
rows and rows of carnations, roses, tulips, orchids, and many other types of
exotic flowers.  In the far right corner of the room is the counter with the
cash register for you to pay for your purchases.  The room is dimly lit, but
seems to be brightened by the presence of the flowers and the sunlight coming
through the glass covering the west wall.

Exits.Description: You see Broad street outside the door.
